revised_title: Acoustic Disturbances Produced by Small Bodies in Plane Waves Transmitted through Water
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the acoustic disturbances produced by small bodies in plane waves transmitted through water, with a focus on the single-plate direction finder. They investigated the essential conditions of baffle action and explored the acoustic fields around various small discs placed in the path of sound waves. Their findings contribute to the understanding of underwater acoustics and direction finding.
